reasoning: Protanopia (red-blindness) is an X-linked recessive color vision deficiency affecting ~1% of males (~10,000 per 100k in males) and <0.01% of females. Global prevalence estimate ~0.8% of population (~8,000 per 100k). Population prevalence data from color vision epidemiology studies.
source: Hunt DM et al. (1995). Molecular genetics of human color vision. Science. 267:1979-1981
